p: P. notoginseng seeds were seeded in sterile quartz sand and roseite with a 1:2 mixture in greenhouse. After germination, seedlings were cultivated under 20 °C with a relative humidity of 70% ± 10% and a photoperiod of 14 h day −1. The seedlings were supplied with full-strength Hoagland nutrient solution. The macronutrient composition of the Hoagland nutrient solution (in mg·L −1) was 40 N (as NH 4NO 3), 10 P (as KH 2PO 4), 40 K (as K 2SO 4 and KH 2PO 4), 57 Ca (as CaCl 2), and 40 Mg (as MgSO 4). The basal micronutrient composition (in mg·L −1) was 2.0 Fe (as Fe-EDTA), 0.2 B (as H 3BO 3), 0.5 Mn (as MnCl 2·4H 2O), 0.05 Mo [as (NH 4) 6Mo 7O 24·4H 2O], 0.01 Zn (as ZnSO 4·7H 2O), and 0.01 Cu (as CuSO 4·5H 2O). Dicyandiamide, a nitrification inhibitor, was added to each nutrient solution to prevent oxidation of ammonium.
